summary: The Eagles are an American rock band formed in 1971. They're super popular, with over 200 million records sold worldwide. The band includes Glenn Frey, Don Henley, Bernie Leadon, and Randy Meisner. They started with hits like "Take It Easy" and "Witchy Woman." Over the years, they added new members and released albums like "Hotel California," which is one of the best-selling albums of all time. The Eagles broke up but reunited in 1994. They've won many awards and were inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 1998.
title: Eagles (band)
